title: Vanguard - The Government Project to get British Businesses to use the Internet
summary: Email isn't an obvious business benefit. Imagine it is the early 1980s and you need to communicate with people across the country. A first-class letter will cost you 17p - about 60p in today's money. The letter will be delivered the next day and you'll have your answer back the day after.  By contrast, a single computer terminal was likely to set you back around £3,000 - and that's before you …
